doc.after: The ecclesiastical forms of Byzantine music composed to Greek texts as ceremonial festival or church music 188 are today the most well known forms Ecclesiastical chants were a fundamental part of this genre Greek and foreign historians agree that the ecclesiastical tones and in general the whole system of Byzantine music is closely related to the ancient Greek system 189 It remains the oldest genre of extant music of which the manner of performance and with increasing accuracy from the 5th century onwards the names of the composers and sometimes the particulars of each musical work s circumstances are known
